thread.title: Non-league AS Excelsior will travel for 16 hours and 9,500km to play their French cup match against Lille
thread.title_full: Non-league AS Excelsior will travel for 16 hours and 9,500km to play their French cup match against Lille

author: rforrester
title: Non-league AS Excelsior will travel for 16 hours and 9,500km to play their French cup match against Lille
text:
EFL Lil' bit much? Non-league AS Excelsior will travel for 16 hours and 9,500km to play their French cup match against Lille 
Dimitri Payet has also been invited as a special guest for the clash By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments NON-LEAGUE French side AS Excelsior were handed the tie of their lives when they drew Lille in the Coupe de France. 
But their reward for taking on the Ligue 1 giants means they will have to travel nearly 10,000km just to reach the Stade Pierre-Mauroy. The journey that the minnows have to make Getty Images 3 Lille will welcome the huge outsiders on Saturday 
That is because Excelsior play their football on the tiny Reunion Island, situated east near the southern tip of Africa. 
The club will need to take an incredible 32 hour round-trip by plane to reach their destination – a total of 19,000km. 
Saint-Joseph, where Excelsior play their home games at their 2,000-capacity stadium, is situated furthest south of the Reunion Island. 
And they will be hoping Dimitri Payet’s appearance for their game can inspire a fairytale giant killing. related articles clock ticking Slaven Bilic has two games to save his job as West Ham manager after Manchester City humiliation Dimitri's reunion It's official: Dimitri Payet returns to his former club hours after sparking rumours that he wants out Pay the price Dimitri Payet sparks West Ham exit rumours after liking a tweet hinting at return to Marseille following FA Cup thrashing to Man City Thai-me for a change Leroy Lita the latest player to join the Asian football revolution... in the Thai League Getty Images 3 Dimitri Payet spent two years at Lille and started his career at AS Excelsior 
The West Ham ace was invited to take a ceremonial kick-off because he used to play for both sides. 
Payet, who was born on the Reunion Islands, kick-started his career at AS Excelsior before making the move to Nantes. 
In 2011 he transferred to Lille where he played for two years. Paul Pogba and Patrice Evra sing Marvin Gaye's Motown classic after France win
